subject: Education
title: Grading Bias: Names Change Scores
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Grading Bias: Names Change Scores.

hook.text: The same essay scored differently depending on whether the author's name sounded white or Black.

buildup.text: Studies repeatedly show that implicit bias affects gradingâ€”gender, race, and attractiveness all matter.

discovery.text: Anonymous grading eliminates most name-based bias, improving fairness significantly.

twist.text: Even rubrics don't fully eliminate biasâ€”teachers apply rubric criteria differently for different students.

climax.text: Calibration sessions where teachers grade the same work and compare scores reduce bias measurably.

punchline.text: Fair grading starts by hiding the name at the top of the page.

quiz.question: What is the most effective simple strategy to reduce grading bias?
options: Anonymous grading that hides student identities
Allowing students to grade each other
